p: Table 2 shows the energy value, binding domain and amino acids found in the active site pockets of 6LU7 against compounds from KK. The Acetoside from Clerodendrum serratum docked with the 3CL pro and the total fitness value was found to be −153.06 kcal/mol, which comprises of −93.6 van der Waal interactions and −59.46 kcal/mol hydrogen bonding interactions. The inhibitor closely fits the active site cavity making various close contacts with the residues including hydrogen bonding with the main chain of arginine at position 131 with binding energy value −9.3 kcal/mol ( Figure 2A). Acteoside, a phenylethanoid glycoside, is an active compound in several plants and traditional herbal medicines (Kubica et al., 2017). The study reports that the acetoside having the highest binding energy is very effective to inhibit the 3CL pro. Similarly, Song et al. ( 2016) reported that the acetoside inhibits viral infections in a dose-dependent manner. The interactions and fitness score of the compound suggest that these leads can be formulated as an anti-COVID drug.
